questions.question: Which of these is a complete sentence?
A complete sentence must have a subject and a ______.
What is the subject of the sentence: 'The cat is sleeping.'?
What is the verb of the sentence: 'She reads a book.'?
Rearrange the words to make a proper sentence: 'likes / he / to play / football'
A sentence that makes a statement should end with a...
Which of these is a complete thought?
options: The girl with the red dress.

questions.question: A sentence must begin with a...
Find the complete sentence.
options: The ball is on the table.
questions.correct_answer: The ball is on the table.

questions.question: Rearrange the words: 'is / my / this / pen'
The subject of a sentence is who or what the sentence is...
The verb in a sentence shows the...
Which sentence is correct?
A question sentence should end with a...
Which of these is a command?
What is the subject? 'Birds fly high.'
What is the verb? 'The baby is crying.'
Rearrange the words: 'school / go / to / I'
Which one is an incomplete sentence?
options: In the garden near the tree.
questions.correct_answer: In the garden near the tree.

questions.question: The basic structure of a simple English sentence is...
Find the complete sentence.
The subject in the command 'Close the door' is...
Rearrange the words: 'is / sky / blue / the'
Which sentence is correctly structured?
A group of words that makes complete sense is called a...
What is the verb in 'The car is red'?
Identify the subject: 'My mother cooks delicious food.'
Which of these is a sentence fragment (incomplete sentence)?
options: The man walked down the street.

questions.question: Rearrange into a question: 'your / is / what / name'
Which sentence is NOT a proper sentence?
The predicate of a sentence is the part that contains the...
options: verb and tells what the subject does
questions.correct_answer: verb and tells what the subject does

questions.question: In 'The children play', what is the predicate?
Which sentence is in the correct order?
options: In the garden are playing the children.
The children in the garden are playing.
Are playing the children in the garden.
The children are playing in the garden.
questions.correct_answer: The children are playing in the garden.

questions.question: A statement is also known as a ______ sentence.
A question is also known as an ______ sentence.
A command is also known as an ______ sentence.
Which of the following is a complete sentence?
options: The girl in the red frock.
The girl in the red frock sings a sweet song.
questions.correct_answer: The girl in the red frock sings a sweet song.

questions.question: Rearrange to make a sentence: 'is / a / it / beautiful / day'
What is the subject in the sentence: 'On the table lies a book.'?
Which sentence makes sense?
Identify the verb: 'He is a smart boy.'
Identify the subject: 'We are learning English.'
Which one is a complete sentence?
Rearrange the words: 'is / what / time / the'
A simple sentence has one subject and one ______.
Which sentence has the correct word order?
A sentence fragment is a piece of a sentence that is missing a subject or a...
Find the complete sentence.
options: The tall man with the hat.

questions.question: Rearrange the words: 'are / you / where / from'
Which sentence is a question?
A sentence with one independent clause is a ______ sentence.
A sentence with two or more independent clauses joined by a conjunction is a ______ sentence.
A sentence with one independent clause and at least one dependent clause is a ______ sentence.
Identify the type of sentence: 'I like tea, and my brother likes coffee.'
Identify the type of sentence: 'I went to the market after I finished my homework.'
A dependent clause is a group of words that...
options: can stand alone as a sentence
cannot stand alone as a sentence
questions.correct_answer: cannot stand alone as a sentence

questions.question: What is the dependent clause in 'He was happy because he won the prize'?
Which coordinating conjunction (FANBOYS) fits best? 'He is poor, ______ he is honest.'
Which subordinating conjunction fits best? '______ it was raining, we played inside.'
Identify the sentence type: 'The cat and the dog are sleeping peacefully.'
What is a 'run-on sentence'?
options: Two or more independent clauses joined without proper punctuation or conjunction
A sentence that is a question
questions.correct_answer: Two or more independent clauses joined without proper punctuation or conjunction

questions.question: How can you fix this run-on sentence? 'I am tired I want to sleep.'
options: I am tired, I want to sleep.
I am tired, so I want to sleep.
I am tired I want, to sleep.
I am tired. I want to sleep.
questions.correct_answer: I am tired, so I want to sleep.

questions.question: Identify the independent clause: 'When the bell rings, the students leave.'
A phrase is a group of words that does not have a...
Which of these is a prepositional phrase?
Identify the type of sentence: 'I will call you if I have time.'
What is the subject of the sentence 'Down the road lived an old man.'?
A sentence with two independent clauses and one or more dependent clauses is a ______ sentence.
Identify the type of sentence: 'When I grow up, I want to be a doctor, but my brother wants to be an engineer.'
What punctuation mark is used to join two independent clauses without a conjunction?
Which sentence is correctly punctuated?
options: He is intelligent; he is also hardworking.
He is intelligent, he is also hardworking.
He is intelligent he is also hardworking.
He is intelligent and, he is also hardworking.
questions.correct_answer: He is intelligent; he is also hardworking.

questions.question: An 'appositive phrase' is a noun phrase that renames another noun right beside it. Which sentence has an appositive?
options: My brother, who is a doctor, lives in Delhi.
My brother, a doctor, lives in Delhi.
My brother is a doctor and lives in Delhi.
questions.correct_answer: My brother, a doctor, lives in Delhi.

questions.question: What is the dependent clause in 'The book that you gave me is very interesting.'?
The sentence 'I came, I saw, I conquered' is a series of three ______.
A 'gerund phrase' starts with a gerund (-ing word) and functions as a...
Identify the gerund phrase: 'Swimming in the ocean is his favorite activity.'
A 'participial phrase' starts with a participle (-ing or -ed) and functions as a/an...
Identify the participial phrase: 'The boy, wearing a blue shirt, is my brother.'
An 'infinitive phrase' starts with 'to' followed by a verb. Find the infinitive phrase: 'He likes to read books.'
Which sentence structure is inverted (verb before subject)?
A 'declarative' sentence makes a statement. An 'interrogative' sentence ______.
An 'imperative' sentence gives a command. An 'exclamatory' sentence ______.
Identify the type of sentence: 'The house is on fire!'
A correctly structured sentence must have 'parallel structure'. Which sentence is parallel?
options: He likes to run, swimming, and to play.
He likes running, swimming, and playing.
He likes to run, to swim, and playing.
He likes running, to swim, and to play.
questions.correct_answer: He likes running, swimming, and playing.

questions.question: A sentence that gives both a reason and a result is likely a ______ sentence.
Which subordinating conjunction introduces a clause of contrast?
Fix this comma splice: 'The rain fell, the wind blew.'
options: The rain fell the wind blew.
The rain fell, and the wind blew.
The rain fell; and the wind blew.
The rain fell, the wind, blew.
questions.correct_answer: The rain fell, and the wind blew.

questions.question: The part of the sentence that contains the subject is called the...
The main noun or pronoun in the complete subject is the...
What is the simple subject in 'The tall boy with the red hat is my brother'?
options: The tall boy with the red hat

questions.question: What is the simple predicate (the main verb) in 'She has been studying for three hours'?
An 'adjective clause' is a dependent clause that modifies a...
An 'adverb clause' is a dependent clause that modifies a...
A 'noun clause' is a dependent clause that functions as a...
Identify the noun clause: 'I know what he said.'
What is a 'misplaced modifier'?
options: A word or phrase that is placed correctly in a sentence.
A word or phrase that incorrectly modifies the wrong word because it is placed too far away.
questions.correct_answer: A word or phrase that incorrectly modifies the wrong word because it is placed too far away.

questions.question: Which sentence has a misplaced modifier? 'The boy ate the sandwich with a happy smile.'
options: Yes, 'with a happy smile' modifies sandwich.

questions.question: A 'dangling modifier' is a phrase that modifies...
Fix the dangling modifier: 'Walking to school, the bus splashed me.'
options: The bus splashed me walking to school.
While I was walking to school, the bus splashed me.
The bus, walking to school, splashed me.
The bus splashed walking to school me.
questions.correct_answer: While I was walking to school, the bus splashed me.

questions.question: Which sentence is structured correctly?
options: All are correct depending on meaning.
questions.correct_answer: All are correct depending on meaning.

questions.question: Identify the type of sentence: 'The journey was long, the road was rough, and the team was tired.'
A sentence that makes a statement but is structured as a question to be polite is a/an... 'Could you please pass the salt?'
What is an 'anastrophe' or 'inversion'?
options: An inversion of the typical word order for rhetorical effect
questions.correct_answer: An inversion of the typical word order for rhetorical effect

questions.question: Which sentence uses anastrophe? 'Never have I seen such a sight.'
options: No, it is a normal sentence.

questions.question: A 'loose' or 'cumulative' sentence is one where the main idea is...
options: at the end of the sentence
at the beginning of the sentence, followed by modifying phrases
questions.correct_answer: at the beginning of the sentence, followed by modifying phrases

questions.question: A 'periodic' sentence is one where the main idea is...
options: at the beginning of the sentence
held until the end of the sentence, creating suspense
questions.correct_answer: held until the end of the sentence, creating suspense

questions.question: Identify the periodic sentence: 'Despite the bad weather and the long delay, the team finally won the match.'
What is an 'absolute phrase'?
options: A phrase that modifies the entire sentence, not a single word, often with a noun and a participle
questions.correct_answer: A phrase that modifies the entire sentence, not a single word, often with a noun and a participle

questions.question: Identify the absolute phrase: 'Her heart pounding, she opened the letter.'
The grammatical structure of 'I think, therefore I am' is...
options: two independent clauses joined by a semicolon (implied)
questions.correct_answer: two independent clauses joined by a semicolon (implied)

questions.question: A 'balanced sentence' is a type of parallel structure where...
options: two or more parts of the sentence have a similar form to emphasize a contrast or comparison
questions.correct_answer: two or more parts of the sentence have a similar form to emphasize a contrast or comparison

questions.question: Which is a balanced sentence? 'Ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.'
options: Yes, it is a balanced sentence.
No, it is a simple sentence.
No, it is a complex sentence.
No, it is a run-on sentence.
questions.correct_answer: Yes, it is a balanced sentence.

questions.question: A 'chiasmus' is a rhetorical device where grammatical structures are...
Identify the chiasmus: 'Never let a fool kiss you or a kiss fool you.'
The use of 'ellipsis' (...) in a sentence indicates...
A sentence that begins with a dependent clause should have a ______ before the independent clause.
Which sentence is punctuated correctly? 'Because it was raining we stayed inside.'
options: Because it was raining we stayed inside.
Because it was raining, we stayed inside.
Because it was raining; we stayed inside.
Because, it was raining we stayed inside.
questions.correct_answer: Because it was raining, we stayed inside.

questions.question: What is a 'non-restrictive clause'?
options: A clause that is essential to the meaning of the sentence.
A clause that provides extra information and is set off by commas.
questions.correct_answer: A clause that provides extra information and is set off by commas.

questions.question: Which sentence has a non-restrictive clause? 'My brother, who lives in Delhi, is a doctor.'
options: Yes, it has a non-restrictive clause.
No, it has a restrictive clause.
No, it is a simple sentence.
No, it is a compound sentence.
questions.correct_answer: Yes, it has a non-restrictive clause.

questions.question: A 'restrictive clause' is one that is...
options: not essential to the meaning and uses commas
essential to the meaning and does not use commas
always at the beginning of a sentence
always at the end of a sentence
questions.correct_answer: essential to the meaning and does not use commas

questions.question: Which sentence has a restrictive clause? 'The boy who won the race is my friend.'
options: Yes, it has a restrictive clause.
No, it has a non-restrictive clause.
No, it is a simple sentence.
No, it is a compound sentence.
questions.correct_answer: Yes, it has a restrictive clause.

questions.question: A sentence fragment used for stylistic effect is called a/an...
Identify the rhetorical fragment: 'A cold day. A grey sky. A long road ahead.'
options: This is a single compound sentence.

questions.question: The use of short, simple sentences (staccato style) can create a sense of...
The use of long, complex sentences can be effective for...
options: making the text easy to read

questions.question: What is the function of the noun clause in 'That he is honest is known to all'?
The sentence 'To err is human, to forgive divine' is an example of...
options: a balanced sentence with parallel structure
questions.correct_answer: a balanced sentence with parallel structure

questions.question: What is the function of the infinitive phrase in 'To succeed in life is his only ambition'?
A sentence that is grammatically correct but logically absurd is a...
Identify the sentence type: 'While I cooked, he set the table, and the children played outside.'
An 'embedded question' is a question that is...
options: part of a declarative sentence or another question
always at the beginning of a sentence
questions.correct_answer: part of a declarative sentence or another question

questions.question: Which sentence contains an embedded question? 'I don't know where he is.'
options: Yes, it contains an embedded question.
No, it is a direct question.
No, it is a simple sentence.
questions.correct_answer: Yes, it contains an embedded question.

questions.question: The style of using many conjunctions in a sentence (e.g., 'He ran and jumped and shouted') is called...
The style of omitting conjunctions between clauses (e.g., 'He came, he saw, he conquered') is called...
The sentence 'He, a man of great integrity, would never lie' contains a/an...
What is the function of the gerund phrase in 'His constant complaining is very annoying'?
Which of these sentences is structurally ambiguous?
options: The boy saw the man with the telescope.
questions.correct_answer: The boy saw the man with the telescope.

questions.question: The sentence 'The car that is parked outside is mine' contains a/an...
The sentence 'He left because he was tired' contains a/an...
The function of a sentence is its purpose. The structure is its...
A sentence that is made up of a series of short, choppy clauses is often a sign of...
options: an immature or simple writing style
questions.correct_answer: an immature or simple writing style

questions.question: 'Having finished his work, he went out to play.' The phrase 'Having finished his work' is a...
The sentence 'The manager wants to see you' has what kind of object for the verb 'wants'?
What is the key to creating complex sentences?
options: Using a variety of clauses and phrases
questions.correct_answer: Using a variety of clauses and phrases

questions.question: A 'kernel sentence' is a...
Combining 'The boy was tall. The boy was wearing a red shirt. The boy won the race.' into one sentence would result in a...
options: All of the above are possible
questions.correct_answer: All of the above are possible

questions.question: The sentence 'Angry and disappointed, the coach left the field' starts with a/an...
Understanding sentence structure is essential for writing that is...
A sentence that starts with 'There is' or 'There are' is using an 'expletive' construction. What is the true subject of 'There are three books on the table'?
The sentence 'It is important to study hard' uses an 'expletive' construction. What is the true subject?
